confession.devil_appearance: appeared in thunderstorm; later as great rat in prison
confession.seduction_date: 9 years before trial (initially claimed), then changed to 19 years earlier when she was 12 years old guarding mother's sheep
confession.seduction_context: During thunderstorm around St. Jean's day. Promised to make her life easier and provide 'beaucoup de biens'. Gave her what appeared to be 100 francs but proved to be leaves. Also claimed approach by 'tourbillon de vent' (whirlwind) three weeks before trial which she drove away by crossing herself.
sabbat_activities: refused to eat at sabbat and was beaten
only attended once at time of first temptation, called on God and Virgin and went home (only out quarter hour)
witches caused hailstorm damaging crops 18 months earlier but she refused to participate

testimony.quarrel_subject: Payment of 12 gros for time Georgette's children spent guarding animals
testimony.threat_quote: que s'il luy mescheoit, elle scavoit bien qui en seroit la cause

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: three weeks after quarrel between husband and Herteman's son

testimony.quarrel_subject: Husband quarrelled with witness's brother Mathieu Bocel at the mill; witness confronted Georgette about threats against her brother
testimony.threat_quote: Became angry and abusive, having to be restrained by bystanders

testimony.quarrel_subject: 8 years before Georgette thrashed witness's child; when reproached became furious
testimony.threat_quote: que si on la faisoit prisonnier elle maintiendroit que touttes les femmes de la pairie estoient telles qu'elle, et la deut on mettres en quattre quartiers

testimony.quarrel_subject: Georgette suggested his wife entrust a cow to her children; wife excused herself

testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle a ceste mauvaise grace d'estre fort cholerée et d'aymer a disputter

testimony.quarrel_subject: son Mengel quarrelled with Colas Herteman
dispute over sharing catch from fishing with Herteman's son Colas
involvement in proposal by Nicolas Mongeot to build a new forge
obtained permission to establish a forge next to Hertemans' house
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle luy envoyeroit des mouches sy chaudes parmy ses oreilles, qu'elles le garderoient bien de dormir

testimony.quarrel_subject: 20 years earlier refused to allow Nicolas Herteman to take a tree he was cutting down
crossed Herteman's land when carting manure
testimony.threat_quote: que ce luy seroit une chere passée

testimony.quarrel_subject: asked for loan of 3 francs; witness said she had not got it

timeline.subject: Georgeatte Herteman
timeline.details: Substitut of PG des Vosges asks prévôt of Bruyeres to take evidence. List of 17 witnesses summoned.

timeline.subject: witnesses
timeline.details: Informations preparatoires begin with witness depositions

timeline.subject: Georgeatte Herteman
timeline.details: PG des Vosges orders her arrest

timeline.subject: Georgeatte Herteman
timeline.details: First interrogation. Initially denied, then confessed to seduction 9 years earlier by devil called Persin during thunderstorm.

timeline.subject: Georgeatte Herteman and witnesses
timeline.details: Further interrogation of accused; pressed on sabbat attendance. Additional witness deposition.

timeline.subject: Georgeatte Herteman
timeline.details: Interrogation - added nothing to earlier confessions; identified no accomplices

timeline.subject: Georgeatte Herteman
timeline.details: Procureur general des Vosges asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Georgeatte Herteman
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

timeline.subject: Georgeatte Herteman
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture. Confessed husband had seduced her and accompanied her to sabbat. Admitted to causing Bernard Meline's illness and making Hubert Gagat hunchbacked. Changed story on timing of seduction to 19 years earlier when she was 12.

timeline.subject: Georgeatte Herteman
timeline.details: Prévôt de Bruyères records assembly of 'bons hommes jugeants' who sentenced Georgette to be 'bruslée toute vive' (burned alive)

timeline.subject: Georgeatte Herteman
timeline.details: Final interrogation. Changed story again, seemed to withdraw direct accusation against husband. Added witches caused hailstorm 18 months earlier. Finally renewed accusation against husband.

timeline.subject: Georgeatte Herteman
timeline.details: Repeated charge against husband at stake but refused to accuse anyone else. Order for enquiry into husband follows.

accomplices_named.name: Colas Herteman (Nicolas Herteman)
accomplices_named.context: Under torture accused her husband of seducing her into witchcraft and accompanying her to sabbat. Repeated accusation at the stake.

accomplices_named.name: Thiriot le Duc
accomplices_named.context: Before torture claimed devil appeared in prison as great rat accompanied by Thiriot le Duc, weaving rope of straw

accomplices_named.name: those recently convicted at Nouzeville
accomplices_named.context: After being racked, said she had seen those recently convicted at Nouzeville (at sabbat)

notable_quotes.speaker: Laurence femme Bernard Meline
notable_quotes.french: que s'il luy mescheoit, elle scavoit bien qui en seroit la cause
notable_quotes.english: that if misfortune befell her, she knew well who would be the cause
notable_quotes.context: Witness's response to Georgette's threats after quarrel over payment

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte Herteman
notable_quotes.french: si on la faisoit prisonnier elle maintiendroit que touttes les femmes de la pairie (entendante de la rue de part et daultres) estoient telles qu'elle, et la deut on mettres en quattre quartiers
notable_quotes.english: if they made her prisoner she would maintain that all the women of the parish were such as she, and they should quarter her
notable_quotes.context: Georgette's defiant statement about being arrested

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgette at mill (reported by witness 4)
notable_quotes.french: que sy ledit Mongeot ne se fut mené sy mal, elle auroit bien peu fournir quelque chose pour guerir sa femme, mais puis qu'il s'estoit porté sy terrible, elle la laisseroit la
notable_quotes.english: that if Mongeot had not behaved so badly, she could have provided something to cure his wife, but since he had been so terrible, she would leave her alone
notable_quotes.context: Georgette's statement about Nicolas Mongeot's sick wife

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengel le Duc (witness 8)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle a ceste mauvaise grace d'estre fort cholerée et d'aymer a disputter, ainsy qu'elle faict avec plusieurs
notable_quotes.english: that she has this bad quality of being very choleric and loving to dispute, as she does with many

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Mongeot (witness 14)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle luy envoyeroit des mouches sy chaudes parmy ses oreilles, qu'elles le garderoient bien de dormir
notable_quotes.english: that she would send him flies so hot around his ears that they would keep him from sleeping
notable_quotes.context: Georgette's threat to blacksmith over forge next to her house

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgette offering bread to Mongeot's wife
notable_quotes.french: Je crois que tu ne l'oserois manger a cause du mauvais crime qu'on me donne
notable_quotes.english: I believe you dare not eat it because of the evil crime they attribute to me
notable_quotes.context: Georgette's comment when offering bread made from new wheat

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgette to Nicolas Mongeot
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle ny yroit pas, encore qu'elle sceut bien quelque chose pour guerir gens et bestes, mais qu'elle n'en gueriroit aucuns a cause des parolles des personnes
notable_quotes.english: that she would not go there, although she knew well something to cure people and beasts, but she would cure none because of people's words
notable_quotes.context: When reproached about not visiting Mongeot's sick wife

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Coignin (witness 16)
notable_quotes.french: que ce luy seroit une chere passée
notable_quotes.english: that it would be an expensive passage for him
notable_quotes.context: Georgette's threat when he crossed her land with manure cart

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte during interrogation
notable_quotes.french: que pour l'honneur de Dieu on la fasse rebaptiser si elle est telle
notable_quotes.english: that for the honor of God they should have her rebaptized if she is such
notable_quotes.context: Crying without tears during first interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte about broken bridge
notable_quotes.french: que le malgrief feu luy puisse manger les mains, et que si elle a este trompée du mauvais elle ne scait que ce soit d'autre facon que de celle la
notable_quotes.english: that cursed fire might eat his hands, and that if she had been deceived by the evil one she did not know it was in any other way than that
notable_quotes.context: Statement made going back to prison about person who broke bridge

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte in confession
notable_quotes.french: loin d'en avoir receu quelque courtoisie, tous malheurs et pauvreté luy sont advenues depuis qu'elle s'est donnée a luy
notable_quotes.english: far from receiving any courtesy, all misfortunes and poverty came to her since she gave herself to him
notable_quotes.context: Speaking about the devil's broken promises

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte at stake
notable_quotes.french: if she was willing to accuse the person nearest to her they should not suspect her of concealing the truth about others
notable_quotes.english: if she was willing to accuse the person nearest to her they should not suspect her of concealing the truth about others
notable_quotes.context: Refusing to name other accomplices besides her husband

relationships.evidence_text: daughter of Aubert le Vaude des Heutes (dead some 9 years)
daughter of Jennon du Boulay (dead before she was married)
Nicolas Mongeot and his wife Mathiatte
ladite Alison avoit nagueres esté battue de son marit Humbert

economic_context.details: Multiple quarrels involved economic issues: payment disputes for children's work guarding animals (12 gros), disputes over fishing catch sharing, disputes over land use (carting manure, tree cutting), forge construction near house, loan request for 3 francs. Economic hardship evident in Georgette's confession about receiving poverty instead of promised wealth. Animal deaths represented significant economic losses to witnesses. Georgette characterized as quarrelsome and vindictive, particularly over economic matters.

harms_catalog.victim_name: Laurence femme Bernard Meline
harms_catalog.harm_description: violent stomach trouble which she thought might be fatal, lasted until next year
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: payment of 12 gros for children guarding animals
harms_catalog.method_alleged: touch - cured after Georgette spoke friendly and touched her on shoulder

harms_catalog.victim_name: calf belonging to Bernard Meline household
harms_catalog.harm_description: died strangely, had to be put in lime after water and 'grenouilles' (frogs) found inside it
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: husband fishing with Herteman's son Colas, dispute over sharing catch, called him 'genoult'

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow belonging to Jannon femme Nicolas Napuel
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill, died after lingering 8 or 9 weeks, with hide and flesh coming away in pieces
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: husband quarrelled with witness's brother Mathieu Bocel at mill; witness confronted Georgette about threat
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft - butcher said 'c'estoit ung mal donné' (it was a given evil)

harms_catalog.victim_name: 5-year-old son of Jannon femme Nicolas Napuel
harms_catalog.harm_description: head hanging down on chest after being pushed by Georgette's son
harms_catalog.method_alleged: touch - cured after Georgette came, spoke 'quelques doulces paroles' and brought bread and milk

harms_catalog.victim_name: Cathelon femme Claudon Ancel
harms_catalog.harm_description: kicked in stomach with such bruising that those who saw it could not believe it was result of single kick from a woman
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Georgette thrashed witness's child 8 years before; when reproached became furious

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow belonging to George Voiry dit de Bul
harms_catalog.harm_description: fallen sick, unable to go to fields
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cured when given 'vieux regayn' (old aftermath grass) as Georgette advised

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow belonging to Mengeon Roffart
harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, sometimes very swollen
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Georgette suggested wife entrust cow to her children; wife excused herself
harms_catalog.method_alleged: entered by back door on pretext of consulting about herbs

harms_catalog.victim_name: ox belonging to Thiriot le Duc
harms_catalog.harm_description: behaved so strangely during illness that several thought it bewitched

harms_catalog.victim_name: cows belonging to Thiriot le Duc
harms_catalog.harm_description: subsequent loss of some cows

harms_catalog.victim_name: several animals belonging to Nicolas Gamel
harms_catalog.harm_description: death of several animals

harms_catalog.victim_name: Mengel Gamel, son of Nicolas Gamel
harms_catalog.harm_description: aged about 20, died; 'ne scait de quelle malheur cest accident arriva'

harms_catalog.victim_name: young bull calf belonging to Bernard Viry
harms_catalog.harm_description: died strangely with water and 'grenouilles' found inside
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel over sharing fishing catch with Herteman's son Colas

harms_catalog.victim_name: beasts belonging to Thierron
harms_catalog.harm_description: losses of beasts
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: involvement in proposal by Nicolas Mongeot to build new forge

harms_catalog.victim_name: animals belonging to Claudon le Roy
harms_catalog.harm_description: lost some animals

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow belonging to Claudon le Roy
harms_catalog.harm_description: had been sick
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cured after entrusted to Georgette's children to guard

harms_catalog.victim_name: Mathiatte, wife of Nicolas Mongeot
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill, 'perclus de ses membres' with neck all twisted, unable to give suck to 4-month-old child
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Georgette offered wife bread made from new wheat; when refused said 'Je crois que tu ne l'oserois manger a cause du mauvais crime qu'on me donne'; wife took it out of fear

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow belonging to Laurent Voiry
harms_catalog.harm_description: lost a cow
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: 20 years earlier refused to allow Nicolas Herteman to take a tree he was cutting down

harms_catalog.victim_name: two horses belonging to Jean Herteman of Cugniecourt
harms_catalog.harm_description: two horses died

harms_catalog.victim_name: Hubert Gagat
harms_catalog.harm_description: 'un gros bos' (large hump) on his back which often discharged

harms_catalog.victim_name: 7-year-old son of Claudate femme Mongeon Valentin
harms_catalog.harm_description: died after being ill only two days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: asked for loan of 3 francs; when refused, threatened; Georgette threw mud at child at school; threatened him after piglets strayed on her land

harms_catalog.victim_name: Bernard Meline
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill on day he made deposition; became demented; felt something in bed and could not rest
harms_catalog.method_alleged: touch and words - visited when no one home, spoke words he didn't understand, touched him as he lay on bed, blew on his face

harms_catalog.victim_name: crops damaged by hailstorm
harms_catalog.harm_description: hailstorm damaged crops
harms_catalog.method_alleged: sabbat weather magic - Georgette claimed she refused to participate

hailstorm that damaged crops 18 months before November 1615

Georgette's confession: 'tous malheurs et pauvreté luy sont advenues'
multiple references to animal deaths causing economic loss
religious_calendar_references: feast of St. Mathieu (September 21, when witness spoke with Jean Herteman)

legal_context.redress_outcome: Witnesses note Hertemans never denied being called witches nor took legal action despite being called witches publicly multiple times
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Held in prison at Bruyeres; devil appeared to her in prison as great rat

hearsay_chains.content: Georgette said at mill she could have provided something to cure Mongeot's wife but wouldn't because of how he behaved
beggar told him about staying at Hertemans and woman arriving to say there was rumor they'd be arrested
Jean wished Georgette already burned; told of two horses dying after quarrel when carting manure
Humbert had hump on back which he attributed to Georgette
Bernard told him Georgette visited when alone, spoke words he didn't understand, touched him, gave him sickness
several had suggested cow's swelling was witchcraft
ox behaved so strangely during illness that several thought it bewitched

emotional_state_notes: asked if she were not 'fort vindicative', replied she was quick to anger but also quick to calm and ready to give of her goods
prayed 'que pour l'honneur de Dieu on la fasse rebaptiser si elle est telle'
cried 'alarme' when back in prison and begged to tell more
upset about allegations against her (three weeks before trial)
contrite about being deceived by devil

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: claimed threat about 'mouches' had been from Nicolas Mongeot to her, not from her to him; said piece of bread had been taken from her hand by child who gave it to mother

third_parties.name: Mathieu Bocel
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: brother of Jannon femme Nicolas Napuel
third_parties.context: quarrelled with witness's husband at the mill

third_parties.name: Thiriot le Duc
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: enemy - accused husband of inducing him to insult her
third_parties.context: appeared with devil as rat in prison vision; Georgette complained he was sent to insult her

third_parties.name: poor beggar from Sercoeur
third_parties.context: witnessed woman arriving to warn Hertemans of arrest rumor

third_parties.name: Hubert (Humbert) Gagat
third_parties.context: paistre des porcs; had hump on back attributed to Georgette; damaged little bridge

third_parties.name: Toussainct Musnier
third_parties.context: told about Georgette's statement at mill regarding Mongeot's wife

third_parties.context: beaten by husband Humbert; talked about badly at forge

third_parties.name: Mathiatte (wife of Nicolas Mongeot)
third_parties.context: fell ill after accepting bread from Georgette; descended from 'race fort suspecte'

third_parties.context: aged about 20, died 14 months before testimony after quarrelling with Colas Herteman

extraction_metadata.notes: This trial record is exceptionally detailed with 25 witness depositions documenting extensive reputation and specific harm allegations. The confession narrative is complex with multiple retractions and changes, particularly regarding timing of seduction (9 years vs 19 years). The accused showed both resistance and eventual compliance under torture. Notable features: quarrelsome reputation with multiple documented conflicts; pattern of harm-cure sequence; economic disputes underlying many accusations; hereditary suspicion (Mongeot's grandmother executed, his wife from 'suspect race'); accusation of husband which led to further inquiry. The case demonstrates typical Lorraine trial structure with informations preparatoires, multiple interrogations, torture, Change de Nancy approval, and execution.
